summary: This is an email chain between prosecutors discussing an upcoming interview with Juan Alessi, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager. The emails coordinate staffing for the interview, noting its purpose is to identify other employees and gather observations from the New York house.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Identified as the subject of an upcoming interview. The purpose is to identify other employees and gather information about activities at Epstein's New York house.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the employer of Juan Alessi. The interview of Alessi is part of the investigation into Epstein.

connections.description: Alessi is described as Epstein's long-time house manager in New York.

events.title: Prosecutors coordinate interview of Juan Alessi
events.description: Prosecutors exchange emails to finalize plans for an interview with Epstein's former house manager, Juan Alessi, scheduled for Monday.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were planning to interview Juan Alessi, Jeffrey Epstein's long-time house manager in New York, in September 2019.
The stated purpose of the interview was to identify other employees of Epstein and to see what, if anything, Alessi observed at the New York house.
The email chain shows internal coordination among prosecutors regarding staffing for investigative interviews.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
